DOC.brief_summary: Revascularization strategy ST elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) study ( ASSIST-CMR ) compare effect two revascularization strategy [ sit multivessel primary PCI ( SS-PCI ) culprit vessel primary PCI ( IRA-PCI ) ] myocardial infarct size ( MIS ) determine cardiac magnetic resonance ( CMR ) image patient present STEMI multivessel disease ( MVD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Revascularization Strategies STEMI ; The CMR Endpoint Study
DOC.criteria: High risk ST elevation myocardial infarction evidence : ≥2 mm ST elevation 2 anterior lateral lead ; ≥2 mm ST elevation 2 inferior couple ST depression 2 contiguous anterior lead total ST deviation ≥8 mm ; New leave bundle branch block least 1 mm concordant ST elevation . Multivessel CAD evidence ≥1 significant ( ≥70 % visual assessment FFR < 0.80 5070 % stenosis ) stenosis nonIRA . Successful IRAPCI < 10 % residual angiographic stenosis TIMI III flow . Written informed consent . Age ≤ 18 year . Prior coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) surgery . Administration thrombolytic therapy . NonIRA stenosis chronic total occlusion locate leave main artery . Hemodynamic instability evidence BP < 90 mmHg , Killip class ≥2 , need inotropes/vasopressors . Known renal insufficiency ( estimate GFR < 50ml/min ) . Contraindication CMR .
